text: Options aren't always the right product and that's a big problem with options traders even you could tell by the name there It means that they identify as trading options. I consider myself a trader sometimes most of the time I trade options But sometimes it's other things because when you trade options There are a handful of things you gotta be right on you have to be correct in terms of your direction You have to be correct in terms of your volatility assumption You have to be correct in a certain amount of time. There are a lot of things that get added when you trade an options product versus an equity product And it's not always the correct vehicle. Don't get too attached to options Think about the trade hypothesis you have and then find the right product for it being all-ersy-olour

metadata.title: DON'T Be an Options Trader #investing #trading #optionstrading

ABOUT:
My name is Erik, I'm a Marine veteran and self-made millionaire investor. I've spent over 30,000+ hours honing my craft and outpaced the market for the last 15 years. My goal is to share quality information and connect others to resources - without the BS. 

The Outlier Community is built to connect you with other driven people who are pursuing or have achieved financial outlier status. We get together to capitalize on the hive mind to share ideas, explore stock market news, cover investing basics, options trading, portfolio management, investing psychology, strategy, money management, live trading ideas, workshops, and more. None of us find success solely on our own - here we create it together. Welcome to the Outliers!

I am not a financial advisor. All content is shared for educational and entertainment purposes only.
